receives a template and returns a formatted version of it according to a provided variable dictionary

packager.do(command, retries=2, sleeper=3, capture=False, combine_stderr=False)¶

executes a command locally with retries on failure.

Parameters:
  • command (string) – shell command to be executed
  • retries (int) – number of retries to perform on failure
  • sleeper (int) – sleeptime between retries
  • capture (bool) – should the output be captured for parsing?
  • combine_stderr (bool) – combine stdout and stderr
Return type:

responseObject
packager.get(package=False, version=False, source_repo=False, source_ppa=False, source_key=False, source_url=False, key_file=False, reqs=False, dst_path=False, name=False, package_path=False, modules=False, gems=False, overwrite=True)¶

retrieves resources for packaging

packager.get_package_configuration(component)¶

retrieves a package’s configuration from packages.PACKAGES

packager.handle(func)¶

handles errors triggered by fabric

packager.init_logger()¶

Initialize a logger to be used throughout the packager

packager.main()¶
packager.pack(package, name=False, src_type=False, dst_type=False, src_path=False, dst_path=False, version=False, package_path=False, bootstrap_script=False, bootstrap_template=False, depends=False, bootstrap_script_in_pkg=False, config_templates=False, overwrite=True)¶
creates a package according to the provided package configuration
in packages.py

uses fpm (https://github.com/jordansissel/fpm/wiki) to create packages.

Note

by default, the params are defined by packages.py they can be overriden explicitly by sending them to the pack function.

Note

param names in packages.py can be overriden by editing definitions.py

Parameters:
  • package (dict) – dict representing package config as configured in packages.py
  • name (string) – package’s name will be appended to the filename and to the package depending on its type
  • src_type (string) – package source type (as supported by fpm)
  • dst_type (string) – package destination type (as supported by fpm)
  • src_path (string) – path from which package will be created
  • dst_path (string) – path where temp package is placed
  • version (string) – version to append to package
  • package_path (string) – path where final package is placed
  • bootstrap_script (string) – path to place generated script
  • bootstrap_script_in_pkg (string) –
  • config_templates (dict) – configuration dict for the package’s config files
  • overwrite (bool) – indicated whether the destination directory be erased before creating a new package
